news_header: Sir David Attenborough reflects on the impact of wildlife broadcasting over his 70-year career, emphasizing its role in raising awareness about conservation issues.
news_text: Seventy years after starting his wildlife broadcasting career, Sir David Attenborough acknowledges the significant impact of natural history programs on public awareness of conservation issues. He believes that without such broadcasting, the world's ecological situation would be much worse. As the BBC prepares to celebrate 90 years of broadcasting from Bristol, Attenborough recalls the evolution of wildlife programming, from capturing animals for zoos to highlighting the risks faced by the natural world today. He reflects on the advancements in filming technology and the importance of Bristol's Natural History Unit in pioneering wildlife documentaries. Despite his global recognition, Attenborough remains modest about his contributions, crediting the entire team behind the productions. His upcoming series, 'Asia,' is set to premiere in late 2024.
